GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/mountains.description: Serves an array of all mountains. By default sorts by hill name and orders in ascending order. Accepts a body with search params: 'name', 'lowestHeight', 'highestHeight' and 'country'. Only one param can be searched at a time and params not being searched must be set to null for example: {'name': 'Ben Nevis','lowestHeight': null,'highestHeight': null,'country': null}. 'lowestHeight' and 'highestHeight' are considered one search param for example : {'name': 'null','lowestHeight': 2700,'highestHeight': 2900,'country': null}

mountains.description1: Ben Nevis (/ˈnɛvɪs/ NEV-iss; Scottish Gaelic: Beinn Nibheis [pe(ɲ) ˈɲivɪʃ]) is the highest mountain in Scotland and the United Kingdom. The summit is 1,345 metres (4,413 ft)[1] above sea level and is the highest land in any direction for 459 miles (739 kilometres).[3][a] Ben Nevis stands at the western end of the Grampian Mountains in the Highland region of Lochaber, close to the town of Fort William.
mountains.observations: man-made structure supporting emergency structure is higher
mountains.description2:
The mountain is a popular destination, attracting an estimated 100,000 ascents a year,[4] around three-quarters of which use the Mountain Track from Glen Nevis.[5]
The 700-metre (2,300 ft) cliffs of the north face are among the highest in Scotland, providing classic scrambles and rock climbs of all difficulties for climbers and mountaineers. They are also the principal locations in Scotland for ice climbing.
mountains.feature: no feature: natural ground 10m NW of trig point

GET /api/mountains/:hillnumber.description: Takes a hill number as  a parameter and serves a single mountain

GET /api/users/:userToken.description: Takes a user Token as a parameter and serves the corresponding user

POST /api/users/:userToken.description: Takes a user Token as a parameter and serves the newly created user.

PATCH /api/users/:userToken.description: Takes a user Token as a parameter and a request body and responds with the updated user. * Request body example {'hillClimbed': ['Ben Nevis'],'noOfHillsClimbed': 1, 'totalFeetClimbed': 4411 }.
